content: The team decided to create an immersive augmented reality experience for urban explorers.
Unity with Vuforia or Microsoft Hololens is proposed as the AR platform due to robust SDKs and community support.
The team aims to have a rough prototype in two weeks, focusing on tech requirements and UI/UX design.
The team agreed to integrate narrative-driven design and secure data handling into the project.
The project will focus on developing an AR mobile app that combines urban exploration with interactive storytelling.
Unity with Vuforia will be used for the tech stack to balance flexibility and performance.
The app will include features such as a map, AR overlays, an interactive quest log, and social sharing options.
Security and data handling measures will be prioritized early in development.
A prototype with key features is planned to be ready within two weeks.
We decided to use C# with FMOD or BASS libraries for real-time audio processing.
The team agreed on incorporating AI-driven sound optimization and voice command control features.
The app must support cross-platform integration and simulate real user workflows during testing.
We decided to use real-time AI-driven sound optimization and voice command control as key features.
The feature list must be finalized by next week.
UI mockups should support drag-and-drop functionality and split-screen modes.
Uma will draft a user flow for voice command interactions with the UI.
